metadata.dc:author: Góngora-Rivera, Fernando
Delgado-García, Guillermo
Estañol-Vidal, Bruno
Díez-Tejedor, Exuperio
metadata.dc:description: In 1787, three Colonial physicians quoted from Le Clerc (1726-1798) in the Gazeta de México. The French author lists six specific cases where bloodletting is often fatal, including two kinds of apoplexy: the serous and the lacteal. Both conditions are nowadays unknown to the majority of specialists in clinical neurology, and we therefore conducted an historical review of these conditions.
metadata.dc:title: Dos clases de apoplejía en la prensa novohispana.
Two kinds of apoplexy in the Colonial press.
